instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
hi guys ,

the board looks clean after inspection . it powers on only when dcjack/audio board ribbon connector (821-1722-a) unplugged . the jack . no tace of liquid on or under j500. i have tried with a new audio board and ribbon cable but same result .
When the cable is plugged in the charging light stays on and goes orange as normal . the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3HOT</SIGNAL> = 8.54v  with the ribbon connected or without being connected

kindly advise .
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message: Corrosion/damage on the connector board side.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
hi , 
           thanks for the reply ,  what would be stopping it from powering on as removing the ribbon cable brings it  to life .  there is no corrosion/damage present .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message: I would check inside the connector and the ribbon very carefully. i've had some of these where something gets stuck inside the connector and either bridges some pins or screws up the ribbon.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
Not much on that connector that could prevent boot. Either <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> or FINSTACKSNS being pulled low or <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> being shorted to GND.
I still suspect a parts issue, bad cable or IO board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
hi ,
thanks for the reply and the information . i have looked at the connector carefully but i am not able to see any thing wrong with it . i am also trying to load the pic but i am receiving error of wrong file extension.
smc _lid = 3.3 v
FINSTACKSNS = 0.05 and <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> =.05 WHEN THE RIBBON CABLE IS PLUGGED IN . ______ these two are going down

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALT_AUD_LDO_EN</SIGNAL> goes into <RESISTOR>R9501</RESISTOR> ( no stuff) .

i have attempted with new board and new ribbon cable . so far same result . there is not short to ground on any of these lines .
any thing else need to be looked at before i remove the connector .

kindly advise

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
Uhm, send me a picture of the plugged in cable please....

And of course 3v3 so and finstack will be 0 as the board is not powering on. I asked for a short to GND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
hi , 
          thanks for the response , there is no short to ground on when the cable is connected , the reading on continuity or diode mode is 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = .658

finstack alt= 1.298  when uplugged no reading = tested on <RESISTOR>R5210</RESISTOR> .. 

Regarding the pic ,  i am tryin to upload but they are failing with extension error .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message:
There is no use is pulling the connector without figuring out what is going on.
The measurements you give are the with cable AND IO board connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message: Please post a picture of the cable plugged in, not just the connector, Just take it from your phone without the microscope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / power on only if ribbon connector disconnected.
threads.message: I have no idea. Only thing I can advice is to check all Odd number pins on diode mode and compare to a good board. This is with IO board connected.
